response_requirements.initial_response_description: Public body must respond within 5 working days of receipt; day one is day after request received; weekends and holidays not counted
response_requirements.final_response_notes: If impossible to respond within 5 days, may extend for 7 additional working days (12 days total maximum) with written explanation
response_requirements.extension_notes: May extend by 7 working days; must explain in writing conditions making 5-day response impossible

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Actual costs of responding to FOIA requests including staff time spent searching; cannot include general overhead costs
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Actual cost of copying; varies by format and agency

exemptions.description: Records specifically made confidential by law
Personnel records with limited exceptions for salary and position information
Law enforcement investigative records during active investigation
Social security numbers and personal information balanced against public interest

appeal_process.first_level: General District Court or Circuit Court
appeal_process.first_level_notes: No administrative appeal process; denied requester may file petition for mandamus or injunction directly in court; petition heard within 7 days of filing
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Petitioner entitled to reasonable costs, expert witness fees, and attorney fees if substantially prevails, unless special circumstances would make award unjust; civil penalties $500-$2000 for willful violations

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No requirement to state identity or purpose; any person may request records
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: No specific format required; may be oral or written (written recommended); must adequately identify desired records
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must adequately identify desired records

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Each public body should designate FOIA officer as contact point for requests
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must provide records in requested format if readily available; electronic records have same access rights as paper
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Liberally construed to promote increased awareness of governmental activities; exemptions narrowly construed
agency_obligations.training_notes: Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council provides guidance and training

oversight_body.name: Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council
oversight_body.role: Provides guidance and training on FOIA compliance; issues advisory opinions; maintains directory of FOIA officers; located in legislative branch
oversight_body.contact_info: Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council
oversight_body.advisory_committee: Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council serves as advisory body

primary_sources: Code of Virginia Title 2.2, Chapter 37, Sections 2.2-3700 through 2.2-3714
Virginia Freedom of Information Act statutory text
Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council guidance
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Virginia statute. Response timeline: 5 working days with 7-day extension allowed (12 days maximum); working days exclude weekends and holidays. No administrative appeals - direct judicial review only via mandamus/injunction petition heard within 7 days. Attorney fees available to substantially prevailing petitioners. Strong liberal construction mandate favoring disclosure with narrow construction of exemptions. Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council provides guidance, training, and advisory opinions. FOIA officer designation recommended. Civil penalties $500-$2000 for willful violations. May require deposit if estimated cost exceeds $200.
